Message.Title: FUNG RED ALERT: THE BLUE PIG IS ABOUT TO GO OINK...OINK...OINK
Message.Msg: Personally, I'm selling all my shares of the BLUE PIG. You all know that now is the time to take profits.

The market has been correcting for a few weeks. It doesn't go straight up or straight down. The Nasdaq saw a peak of 3196 on September 21 and is now trading at 3072. That is 120 points in less than a month on the growth index. Sure, the market is up this week. Which gives it an even greater chance of going down in future weeks. IBM has pierced its 10 week and 40 week lines in heavy volume. That is a red flag for any trader. I hold long term, and not looking to add, so I could care lees where IBM trades in the short term.

Message.Title: All is good, no worries!
Message.Msg: Expect nice recovery - no worries.

Message.Title: Contracts?
Message.Msg: IBM CFO, Mark Loughridge, stated that contracts had been postponed from Q3 to Q4. If that is the case, then we can expect some major contract announcements in the next 10 weeks. I suspect after the elections? I will be waiting...

The problem with waiting for the elections is that if Obama wins the market is probably going to be rough for a while. I bet we could get a 10% correction -- or more. On the other hand if Romney wins we could see a rally.
truly a much better alternative.....

Topic.Title: IBM doing better than overall markets

Message.Msg: Today is the 25th anniversary of the 1987 market crash. Weak stocks like IBM are vulnerable if the market slides further.

Message.Title: What was good in IBM's 3Q earnings report
Message.Msg: Smarter Planet revenue was up 20% yr/yr, growth markets were up 7% yr/yr, and Business Analytics revenue up 14% yr/yr. IBM's 3Q cloud revenue was greater than their entire cloud revenue of 2011. IBM will continue to grow and take marketshare from competitors.

Topic.Title: IBM doing better than overall markets

Message.Msg: IBM hanging in there. Market keeping it from a $2 gain.
IBM has corrected. Now holding steady. Has soon as Market adjust, IBM will Surge.

Message.Title: IBM Security Software announced
Message.Msg: Yesterday IBM announced 10 business security software programs. This was the largest announcement since the announcement of IBM's Security division. On Weds, it was reported that BBT's website has been attacked by Islamist extremists, and that other banks have been under attack as well. In the news over the last 4 weeks, companies have repeatedly reported security breaches. Security has become an opportunity where spending will rise to $21 billion in 2013, according to Gartner Research.

Topic.Title: IBM doing better than overall markets

Message.Msg: IBM has done better than the market for the last decade and it will continue to do so. Long-term investors will not sell their shares on this dip.

Message.Title: EPS vs Revenue
Message.Msg: IBM’s management has done an excellent job of increasing EPS by decreasing cost and shares outstanding. I don’t think it can do much more this way. It has reached a tipping point It must start increasing revenue. Its diversity and willingness to change as necessary to meet challenges new to the economy is why I still think it is a good long term investment. The current volatility is caused more by day traders than investors such as Warren Buffet.

Message.Title: I'm on the sidelines
Message.Msg: IBM has had great relative strength today. It's gone thru $194 three times but hasn't tested $193 so $194 looks like a good entry point. At this point I'm worried about the "Fiscal Cliff". Obama says that he will use his veto power if any bill is passed without tax hikes over $250k per couple. It looks like the Fiscal Cliff will start to be a topic on the talk shows this weekend. If the Republicans hold the house and pick up 8 of the 12 Senate seats in contention it will give them 61, and if they do that Romney will be the winner and then like 2008 - 2010 the Republicans can do just about anything. But I doubt that is going to happen. So Romney could become President and without the Senate going Republican too the Bush tax cuts will expire. That could trigger a sell off because Obama Care will be implemented too. I'd like to stay on the IBM sidelines until it becomes clear that Romney is in the lead. If not I'd like to stay out until the election. If Obama wins I think there would be a major sell-off across the board. But I'll try and not let IBM walk away from me either. So I may have to get back in if IBM stays strong.
